TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit DataProtectionPermission extends System.Security.CodeAccessPermission implements class System.Security.Permissions.IUnrestrictedPermission

Docs.summary: Controls the ability to access encrypted data and memory. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This permission is used to control the ability to encrypt data and memory using the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ProtectedData> and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ProtectedMemory> classes.

remarks.format:

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.IPermission Copy() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates and returns an identical copy of the current permission.
Docs.returns: A copy of the current permission.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A copy of the permission represents the same access to resources as the original permission.
## Examples The following code example shows the use of the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.DataProtectionPermission.Copy%2A> method. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.DataProtectionPermission> class.
> [!NOTE] > The code example is intended to show the behavior of the method, not to demonstrate its use. In general, the methods of permission classes are used by the security infrastructure; they are not typically used in applications.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the data and memory protection flags.
Docs.value: A bitwise combination of the values.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property specifies whether the `Protect` and `Unprotect` methods of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ProtectedData> and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ProtectedMemory> classes can be used.
## Examples The following code example shows the use of the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.DataProtectionPermission.Flags%2A> property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.DataProtectionPermission> class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Security.Permissions.DataProtectionPermission.FromXml%2A> method reconstructs a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.DataProtectionPermission> object from an XML encoding defined by the <xref:System.Security.SecurityElement> class. Use the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.DataProtectionPermission.ToXml%2A> method to XML-encode the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.DataProtectionPermission>, including state information.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.IPermission Intersect(class System.Security.IPermission target) cil managed

Docs.param: A permission to intersect with the current permission. It must be the same type as the current permission.
Docs.summary: Creates and returns a permission that is the intersection of the current permission and the specified permission.
Docs.returns: A new permission that represents the intersection of the current permission and the specified permission. This new permission is if the intersection is empty.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The intersection of two permissions is a permission that describes the set of operations they both describe in common. Only a demand that passes both individual permissions will pass the intersection.
## Examples The following code example shows the use of the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.DataProtectionPermission.Intersect%2A> method. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.DataProtectionPermission> class.
[!code-cpp[System.Security.Permissions.DataProtectionPermission2#10](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.DataProtectionPermission2/CPP/dataprotect.cpp#10)] [!code-csharp[System.Security.Permissions.DataProtectionPermission2#10](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.DataProtectionPermission2/CS/dataprotect.cs#10)] [!code-vb[System.Security.Permissions.DataProtectionPermission2#10](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.DataProtectionPermission2/VB/dataprotect.vb#10)]

Docs.exception: is not and does not specify a permission of the same type as the current permission.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool IsSubsetOf(class System.Security.IPermission target) cil managed

Docs.param: A permission to test for the subset relationship. This permission must be the same type as the current permission.
Docs.summary: Determines whether the current permission is a subset of the specified permission.
Docs.returns: if the current permission is a subset of the specified permission; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The current permission is a subset of the specified permission if the current permission specifies a set of operations that is wholly contained in the specified permission. For example, a permission for <xref:System.Security.Permissions.DataProtectionPermissionFlags.ProtectData> access is a subset of a permission for <xref:System.Security.Permissions.DataProtectionPermissionFlags.AllFlags> access.
## Examples The following code example shows the use of the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.DataProtectionPermission.IsSubsetOf%2A> method. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.DataProtectionPermission> class.
> [!NOTE] > The code example is intended to show the behavior of the method, not to demonstrate its use. In general, the methods of permission classes are used by the security infrastructure; they are not typically used in applications.
[!code-cpp[System.Security.Permissions.DataProtectionPermission2#3](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.DataProtectionPermission2/CPP/dataprotect.cpp#3)] [!code-csharp[System.Security.Permissions.DataProtectionPermission2#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.DataProtectionPermission2/CS/dataprotect.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Security.Permissions.DataProtectionPermission2#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.DataProtectionPermission2/VB/dataprotect.vb#3)]

Docs.exception: is not and does not specify a permission of the same type as the current permission.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool IsUnrestricted() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a value indicating whether the current permission is unrestricted.
Docs.returns: if the current permission is unrestricted; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks An unrestricted permission represents access to all resources protected by the permission.
## Examples The following code example shows the use of the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.DataProtectionPermission.IsUnrestricted%2A> method. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.DataProtectionPermission> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.IPermission Union(class System.Security.IPermission target) cil managed

Docs.param: A permission to combine with the current permission. It must be of the same type as the current permission.
Docs.summary: Creates a permission that is the union of the current permission and the specified permission.
Docs.returns: A new permission that represents the union of the current permission and the specified permission.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The result of a call to <xref:System.Security.Permissions.DataProtectionPermission.Union%2A> is a permission that represents all operations represented by both the current permission and the specified permission. Any demand that passes either permission passes their union.
## Examples The following code example shows the use of the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.DataProtectionPermission.Union%2A> method. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.DataProtectionPermission> class.
